body.description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This scares me - its fast but HOT
reviews.reviewText: This was pulling too much juice even when idle. I was hitting 61c just looking at a web page. I tried a few driver installations and finally got the right magic that took the temps down toe 50+ but this is not a good spot to be in. I subsequently updated the bios and it added 4 degrees. I downloaded fancontrol (get this!) and was able to get idle temps about 46c. I'm not happy with what was required to achieve an acceptable temp.I purchased a different 3090 that doesn't give me the headaches that this one did and popped this one into a different, and new, PC. The PSU popped and the horrible odor made it apparent that something burned out. It was, in fact, the PSU. I worried that this took the mobo down with it but that was not the case. I can't say for certain that this product test drove the apparent bug inside the PSU but I ended up getting a different brand of PSU just in case and I returned this 3090, for which I got a prompt refund.I ended up buying a 4090 instead of replacing this as it was, which I'm very happy with, and put it into its intended target with a new PSU. Everything is working great and the mobo did not suffer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The box was the only thing that looked like it had ever been used.
reviews.reviewText: The GPU is working great. It looks brand new as far as I could tell, with not a spec of dust anywhere visible on the cooler. It came in an original EVGA box, which had obvious signs of use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I was kind of hesitant to get a like new product but went ahead anyways it was a good decision I have already bought a water block for it anyways but that's the only way to keep these cards from burning up to soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Card arrived in all original packaging which was nice but definitely not refurbished. This is a used card at best. All cooling fins are packed with debris/hair. The card wasn’t even cleaned. Unfortunately I don’t have a way to test the card because my PC is custom looped. Just be cautious of “refurbished”

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2022
reviews.reviewText: 850Watts was not enough when running a 10700k I had to run out and get a 1000 watt

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Out preformed by my 3070TI
reviews.reviewText: The packing was ok, the card appeared clean. However this card severely under preformed my 3070TI FTW3. Getting 30-50 less FPS in benchmarks. Very glad I did take the time to test both cards and didn't just take it at face value that the 3090 would be significantly better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wary but works
reviews.reviewText: Made sure I did extensive research before ordering, and even contacted the owner selling the cards to ask a few questions. Was told by the owner that most cards shipped in their original packaging, with all original components included. Mine didn't, and I was very wary upon it's arrival whether I got a working card or not. First off, the packaging looks like it went through a war zone, probably more of the fault of UPS than the seller, however the packaging itself left a lot to be desired also. Was wrapped and packed fully with bubble wrap so at least the card didn't move around to much in travel, but still low quality packing effort for an expensive card. The second issue/red flag is the card itself, the metal backplate lining the video outputs was bent in two places, and unable to fit into my motherboard upon first try. With some elbow grease and a pair of pliers, I was able to bend it back fairly easy into a shape that would fit into its slot, without damaging the card. It is a renewed card, so there is some leeway for being a used card, however I would have expected the metal backplate to be replaced at least. Despite the emotional rollercoaster of red flags I got upon its arrival, I finally managed to slide it into the motherboard, wire it up, turned it on, and it worked like a charm. No weird sounds, display came right up the first time. I used furmark and a couple 3rd party programs to benchmark the card and make sure it draws power fine and is working like it should, and it absolutely does. So far all my games have run great, and modded skyrim runs especially well with the 24gb VRAM. Felt like a risky buy, but for the price I would have no problem bending a metal plate back again if that's the only issue I'll run into from this seller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Even with the 4000 series out, this card punishes games at high frame rates. I have absolutely no regrets with buying this card. I may buy a second to link, just for the hell of it.
